H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H1226.def: = a prolonged period of dry weather ◄ due to scanty rainfall; ≈ injurious to crops, and so to all who depend on them for survival

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H56.def: = to experience grief and show this by one's actions; ◄ caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances

H535.def: = state of being unable to function as can be expected; ◄ as a result of destruction, a drought, or God's direct intervention; ► results include weakness, sadness, shame, death, and disintegration, depending on the situation

H6937.def: = process by which an object becomes dark in color

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H6682.def: = process of crying out loud ◄ caused either by joy or by grief ► in order to give vent to one's feelings

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

21.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations

H117.def: = pertaining to inspiring awe and respect ◄ because of one's beauty, size, strength, or status

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H6810.def: literally: small; hence: = state in which humans are considered unworthy of honor and respect

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H1356.def: = a depression at the bottom of a waterbody, ► where water can still be found even when most of the water has dried up

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H3637.def: = state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done

H2645.def: = causative action by which humans cover an object with a thin layer of a substance, such as cloth, metal, or wood

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H127.def: = the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

H2865.def: = state in which the surface of the soil is broken into many pieces

H1653.def: = water that has fallen as rain

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H406.def: = person practicing agriculture as his profession

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H2645.def: = causative action by which humans cover an object with a thin layer of a substance, such as cloth, metal, or wood

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H1877.def: = a general term for plants, ► used as food by humans and animals; ≈ associated with frailty, but also with prosperity

H6501.def: = wild donkey of a relatively large size but with relatively small ears; it has a fawn color with a whitish chest and belly; ◄ Persian Wild Ass or Onager, Equus hemonius; ≈ associated with both untameable wildness and sexual desire

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H7602.def: = process by which humans or animals strain for breath with an open mouth, ◄ caused by exhaustion or pain

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H8577.def: = mythical sea monster, such as {L:behemoth<SDBH:בְּהֵמֹות>} and {L:leviathan<SDBH:לִוְיָתָן>}

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H6212.def: = any of various plants, herbs, grasses, seed-bearing vegetation that can be consumed by human and/or animal

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H4878.def: = process by which people turn away from someone they had pledged to serve

H7231.def: = process by which people, objects, and events increase in number or frequency

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H6869.def: = a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

H1616.def: = state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker classes within the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the widows, the fatherless, and other people who are poor
